Alternative investment funds: Dispelling myths and unlocking potential | Mint - Mint
summary:
Alternative Investment Funds: Dispelling Myths and Unlocking Potential

Publication Date: September 2023 Source: Mint

Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs) in India have crossed ₹5 trillion in funds raised, with investment commitments nearing ₹12 trillion. However, AIFs only represent about 5% of India's GDP, highlighting significant growth potential compared to the US (50%) and UK (10%).

  • AIFs have seen substantial growth in India.
  • They accounted for ₹5 trillion in raised funds as of September.
  • Total investment commitments are nearly ₹12 trillion.
  • Only 5% of India’s GDP is represented by AIFs.
  • This is a stark contrast to 50% in the US and 10% in the UK.
  • Indicates a promising future for AIFs in India.
“AIFs represent just about 5% of India's GDP, underlining immense growth potential.”

The growth of AIFs demonstrates both rising interest and the potential for significant growth in India’s investment landscape.
newTitle: Alternative Investment Funds: Myths and Potential in India

title: Honda, Nissan deal could be key to comeback against China’s BYD | Company Business News - Mint
NASA Parker Solar Probe Makes Closest-Ever Approach to the Sun, Becomes Fastest Object Built by Humans - Gadgets 360
summary:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Makes Its Closest-Ever Flyby of the Sun

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Gadgets 360

The Parker Solar Probe has completed its closest-ever flyby of the Sun, reaching a distance of approximately 6.1 million kilometers, gathering crucial data about the solar environment.

  • First man-made object to approach this close to the Sun.
  • During the flyby, it achieved a speed of 692,000 km/h, breaking its previous speed record.
  • Communication with the probe was temporarily lost, with reconnection expected by December 27.
  • This was the 22nd flyby of the Sun, with four more planned for 2025.
  • The probe helps scientists understand solar phenomena like coronal mass ejections and their impact on Earth.
“The corona reaches temperatures exceeding 1.1 million degrees Celsius at a certain distance from the Sun.”

This milestone enhances NASA's ability to study solar activity and its implications for Earth, offering insights into solar storms that can affect technology and infrastructure.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Makes Its Closest-Ever Flyby of the Sun

title: Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 20: Only 2% Drop On 3rd Tuesday, Allu Arjun Now Eyeing The 800 Crore Club! - Koimoi

Sukumar’s directorial Pushpa 2 is bringing cheer this Christmas season, with Allu Arjun's film continuing to perform well at the box office. The official figures for the third Tuesday collections have been released.

Maintains an outstanding hold!

The film earned 11.50 crores yesterday, showing minimal drop from 11.75 crores on day 19, with the total collection in the Hindi belt now at 715.75 crores.

Day-wise Box Office Breakdown:

  • Week 1: 433.50 crores (8-day extended week)
  • Week 2: 199 crores
  • Day 16: 12.50 crores
  • Day 17: 20.50 crores
  • Day 18: 27 crores
  • Day 19: 11.75 crores
  • Day 20: 11.50 crores

Total: 715.75 crores

Will it unlock the 800 crore milestone?

The film faces competition with the release of Baby John, which could affect its performance, but it is on track to potentially be the first Hindi film to reach the 800 crore mark.

Note: Box office numbers are based on estimates and have not been independently verified.

title: KKR and Bain each bid more than $5 bln for Seven | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
KKR and Bain Submit Bids Over $5 Billion for Seven & i Assets

Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Reuters

Private equity firms KKR and Bain Capital have each made bids exceeding $5 billion for non-core assets of Japan's Seven & i Holdings. The bidding marks a significant move in the retail landscape as Seven & i seeks to divest from various subsidiaries.

  • KKR's bid is approximately 800 billion yen ($5.1 billion) for York Holdings.
  • Bain Capital's offer stands around 1.2 trillion yen.
  • Japan Industrial Partners has also placed a bid of around 750 billion yen.
  • The bids surpass the expected enterprise value of 500 billion yen set by Seven & i.
  • Seven & i aims to finalize the winning bid by February 2024, with significant implications for the company's future.
“The largest privatisation of a Japanese firm, if realised, would mark a historic development in the market,” according to sources.

This bidding round indicates the companies' strategic focus on streamlining operations and responding to competitive pressures in the retail sector.
newTitle: KKR and Bain Submit Bids Over $5 Billion for Seven & i Assets

Student sexually assaulted by 2 inside Chennai's Anna University campus - Deccan Herald
summary:
Student sexually assaulted by 2 inside Chennai's Anna University campus

Published Date: 25 December 2024, Source: Chennai News

A 19-year-old engineering student was sexually assaulted by two unidentified men at Anna University in Chennai on the evening of December 23. The incident has raised serious concerns about safety on campus.

  • The incident occurred near the Highway Laboratory at approximately 7:45 PM.
  • Two men attacked the victim's male friend before dragging the female student into bushes.
  • The student reported the incident to both the police and the university's Protection of Sexual Harassment committee.
  • Authorities have initiated a criminal case, including charges of rape and sexual harassment.
  • Police are reviewing CCTV footage and have detained a suspect.
  • The incident has prompted criticism from political leaders regarding law and order in the state.
“Such incidents could have been prevented if the government had taken my criticism in the right stride,” - Edappadi K Palaniswami
“Women don’t feel safe in the State anymore.” - K Annamalai

This shocking incident highlights ongoing safety concerns for students in higher education institutions.
newTitle: Student sexually assaulted by 2 inside Chennai's Anna University campus

India is making significant changes to their batting lineup for the Boxing Day Test against Australia, with Rohit Sharma returning to the opening position alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal and KL Rahul moving to No.3.

  • Rohit Sharma will open alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal.
  • KL Rahul replaces Shubman Gill at No.3.
  • Sundar may return to the squad, possibly replacing Nitish Reddy or Akash Deep.

“Let’s not worry about who bats where. Something that we need to figure and not something I would be discussing here. We will do what is best for the team,” Rohit Sharma commented.

‘If India doesn’t respond in time…’: Bangladesh’s Yunus presses for Hasina’s extradition - Firstpost
summary:
‘If India doesn’t respond in time…’: Bangladesh’s Yunus presses for Hasina’s extradition

Date: December 24, 2023 | Source: Firstpost

The interim government of Bangladesh, led by Muhammad Yunus, has requested India's extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, stating they will wait for a formal response before escalating the request.

  • Bangladesh sent a diplomatic note to India seeking Hasina's extradition for judicial proceedings.
  • Under the 2013 extradition treaty, Bangladesh argues for her return, citing various charges against her.
  • If India does not respond within what Bangladesh calls ‘natural time’, they will follow up with a note of urgency.
  • Hasina is accused of serious charges, including murder and crimes against humanity related to protests earlier this year.
  • Yunus’ interim government has been proactive in seeking Hasina's return since taking office in August.
“We informed the Indian government through a Note Verbale that we want her (Hasina) back for the judicial process.” - Touhid Hossain, advisor on foreign affairs

The Yunus administration stresses the importance of timely communication with India regarding this sensitive diplomatic matter.
newTitle: Bangladesh's Yunus Calls for Extradition of Sheikh Hasina from India

title: ‘Fraudulent…without any authority’: Delhi departments issue public notices against 2 AAP schemes - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi Govt Disowns AAP's Health Schemes, Calls Them Fraudulent

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

In a surprising development, senior officers from the Delhi government have publicly disowned two schemes initiated by Chief Minister Atishi and former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. The schemes were aimed at providing financial support to non-tax paying women and free healthcare to seniors.

  • The Delhi government states the Mukhyamantri Mahila Samman Yojna and Sanjeevani Yojna have not been officially approved.
  • Public notices label these schemes as fraudulent, warning against unauthorized application collection.
  • Kejriwal criticized the opposition BJP for attempting to undermine the initiatives.
  • The health department's notice calls out the influx of public inquiries seeking information on the unapproved schemes.
“These people are rattled by the Mahila Samman Yojana and Sanjeevani Yojana. They have planned to arrest Atishi ji in the next few days by filing a fake case.” — Arvind Kejriwal

This episode highlights the ongoing tensions between the elected government and the bureaucratic structure overseeing Delhi.
newTitle: Delhi Govt Disowns AAP's Health Schemes, Calls Them Fraudulent

Video of Pakistan airstrikes targeting suspected Taliban hideouts in Afghanistan surfaces - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pakistan Airstrikes Target Taliban Hideouts in Afghanistan, Resulting in Civilian Casualties

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Pakistan launched airstrikes in Afghanistan's Paktika province, reportedly targeting Taliban hideouts, which resulted in the death of at least 15 people, including women and children. The airstrikes have drawn international condemnation from the Afghan government.

  • The strikes were carried out in a mountainous area along the Pakistan-Afghanistan border.
  • The Afghan Defense Ministry condemned the attacks, claiming they were a violation of international law.
  • This was the second strike on suspected TTP hideouts since March.
  • Local sources indicate the death toll may rise due to the nature of the attack.
  • The attacks occurred shortly after a diplomatic visit by Pakistan’s representative to Kabul.
“The Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan condemns this brutal act against all international principles,” - Afghan Defense Ministry

The airstrike situation exacerbates the rising tensions between Pakistan and Afghanistan amid growing cross-border militant threats.
newTitle: Pakistan Airstrikes Target Taliban Hideouts in Afghanistan, Resulting in Civilian Casualties

title: Toyota global production down for 10th month despite rising sales | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Toyota Global Production Down for 10th Month Despite Rising Sales

Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Reuters

Toyota Motor's global production decreased for the tenth consecutive month in November, despite an increase in worldwide sales driven by strong demand in the U.S. and China.

  • Toyota manufactured 869,230 vehicles globally in November, down 6.2% year-on-year.
  • U.S. output declined by 11.8%, with a slow recovery noted as production for certain SUV models resumed.
  • China's production fell by 1.6%, an improvement over the previous month’s 9% decline.
  • Japan witnessed a 9.3% decrease in output, influenced by a two-day halt at some plants.
  • Worldwide sales rose by 1.7% to 920,569 vehicles, setting a record for November.
  • In the January-to-November period, global output was down 5.2% compared to the previous year.
'Toyota has decided to build an independent plant in Shanghai to manufacture electric cars for its Lexus brand starting in 2027.' – Nikkei

In conclusion, while Toyota faces production challenges, it continues to achieve record sales in a competitive market, signaling resilience amidst adversity.
newTitle: Toyota Global Production Down for 10th Month Despite Rising Sales

title: PM Modi pens article on Atal Bihari Vajpayee on 100th birth anniversary: ‘Wasn't one to cling on to power’ - Hindustan Times
summary:

Date: Wednesday
Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid homage to Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his 100th birth anniversary, highlighting his pivotal role in India's progression into the 21st century and his impact on the country's economic rise.

  • Modi described Vajpayee as a statesman who inspired many and emphasized his principled stance on power.
  • He noted Vajpayee's remarkable leadership during the 1998 Pokhran nuclear tests as emblematic of India's scientific capability and leadership.
  • Modi praised Vajpayee's refusal to cling to power, recounting his resignation in 1996 rather than engaging in unethical politics.
  • Modi highlighted Vajpayee's commitment to the Constitution and his significant contributions to India's technological advancement.
“He stands tall as a statesman who continues to inspire countless people,” - PM Modi

In conclusion, Prime Minister Modi's article is a heartfelt tribute to Atal Bihari Vajpayee, reflecting on his values, vision for India, and lasting legacy in the country.

title: Canadian colleges under ED's scanner for illegally trafficking Indians into US - Hindustan Times
summary:
Canadian Colleges Investigated for Trafficking Indians into the US

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has launched an investigation against certain Indian individuals, entities, and Canadian colleges for allegedly trafficking Indians into the US through Canada. The probe stems from a tragic incident in 2022 involving the deaths of a family from Gujarat while attempting to cross the border illegally.

  • The investigation targets Bhavesh Ashokbhai Patel and associates accused of human trafficking.
  • Individuals were charged between ₹55 and ₹60 lakh for illegal entry into the US.
  • Search operations were conducted at eight locations across various Indian cities.
  • About 25,000 students are referred annually by one entity for overseas college admissions.
  • Over 112 colleges in Canada are implicated in the ongoing investigation.
“All the accused, in conspiracy with each other, lured the innocent Indian nationals by charging them huge amounts for causing them to illegally enter the USA through Canada,” ED statement.

The ED's investigation underscores the dire circumstances that lure individuals into seeking illegal pathways for migration, emphasizing the need for stringent measures against such trafficking schemes.
newTitle: Canadian Colleges Investigated for Trafficking Indians into the US

"Pushpa 2 has now passed the Rs 1600 crore mark, making it the third-biggest Indian film of all time."

In conclusion, Pushpa 2's success at the box office is remarkable but is complicated by the controversies surrounding its screenings and the star's involvement in recent incidents.

title: Christmas Cheer With Snow And Shivers: Shimla, Manali See Tourist Influx As Hill Stations Turn White - News18
summary:
Christmas Cheer With Snow And Shivers: Shimla, Manali See Tourist Influx As Hill Stations Turn White

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: News18

North India, especially Himachal Pradesh and Kashmir, has turned into a Christmas delight for those who love snow and are looking for a festive getaway. However, with this, comes traffic woes in the hilly tourist spots.

  • A maximum of 145 roads were closed in Shimla, followed by 25 in Kullu and 20 in Mandi districts.
  • Snowfall was reported in several areas, including Kinnaur, Lahaul, Spiti, and the higher regions of Shimla and Kullu.
  • Reports indicate a surge in hotel bookings due to increased tourist influx.
  • Four deaths were recorded due to vehicle skidding during the snowfall.
“Khadrala received 24 cm of snow, while Kukumseri in Lahaul and Spiti reported a nighttime low of minus 6.9 degrees Celsius.”

The event showcases both the beauty of winter tourism and the challenges that come with heavy snowfall in mountainous regions.
newTitle: Christmas Cheer With Snow And Shivers: Shimla, Manali See Tourist Influx As Hill Stations Turn White
